result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael James Hobbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $1,115.95 as stipulated to Schmitt/Kilbac.

Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge if not previously done.
Pay mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contract with weapons of any kind.
No contact with ATL or NF, through any means.
No use or possession of-alcohol - absolute sobriety

Commit no new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
Cooperate with Probation Department / Agent for all home and office visits.
Cooperate and participate with AODA and complete any recommended treatment, random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry possess any firearms/body armor, ammunition and explosives. 
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Hobbs

defendant.name: Hobbs, Michael James
defendant.address: 4821 West National Avenue, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael James Hobbs, in custody, in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  
Stephan Eduard Nolten for Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court finds State has complied with victim notification.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Court found the defendant enter a plea freely, voluntarily and knowingly. Court accepted the plea and found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders COUNT 1 DISMISSED and read-in for purposes of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 92 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS - CONCURRENT to sentence being served.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Commit no new law violations arising to the level of probable cause;
- Cooperate with Probation Department / Agent for all home and office visits;
- No contact with weapons of any kind;
- No contact with ATL or NF, through any means.
- Cooperate and participate with AODA and complete any recommended treatment, random urine screens;
- No use or possession of alcohol - absolute sobriety;
- Seek and maintain employment.
- Pay restitution in the amount of $1,115.95 as stipulated to Schmitt/Kilbac;
- Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge (if not previously done);
- Pay mandatory court cost, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor/ammunition and explosives.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel. 

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Michael James Hobbs not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Michael James Hobbs in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Michael James Hobbs in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: police officer Miguel Benitez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving during pendency of case.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ATL

Defendant Michael James Hobbs in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Michael James Hobbs in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael James Hobbs appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
